title: Expert Workshop on Fire Safety Education for the Elderly

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational adult education theories and understanding of online learning environments
context.additional_context: Learners (30-something university students) participate in a workshop based on an expert-developed curriculum to enhance their capacity to design and implement fire safety education programs for the elderly. Digital devices (laptops, tablets, etc.) are provided, and learning effectiveness is measured through real-time interaction and formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more fire safety education strategies tailored to elderly living environments (e.g., nursing facilities, independent households).
Learners can design a comprehensive curriculum covering fire prevention and response procedures.
Learners can develop customized educational content for target groups (facility staff, families, elderly individuals) using online workshop materials.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
